markdownRemark.html:
Git is the kind of awesome tool that keeps giving. Ok, this feature is not as impressive as git worktree or the powerful reflog, but itâ€™s very handy.

Say youâ€™re on a branch. You checkout to master temporarily. Then, you want to come back to your branch. Waitâ€¦ whatâ€™s the name of your branch again?

Turns out, you can just ask git to go back to the previous branch you were on with git checkout -.

It works like cd -: it checkouts the previous branch and if you run it twice, youâ€™ll end up on the same branch youâ€™re now.
